SEARCH

Class ClientMessageHandler

java.lang.Object
ClientMessageHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ClientMessageHandler extends Object implements Runnable
Threaded client message handler to: receive messages from a client socket, handle client commands, and edit Server name with respect to critical section. A client message handler is delegated to a specific client, the principal client.
Version:
11 /1/2023 Fall/2023
Author:
Zachary Cowan

      Instantiates a new Client message handler.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Execution loop for ClientMessageHandler where: client messages are received, client commands are services, and server sends dialogs and responses to requests.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • sendDisconnectToAll

      public void sendDisconnectToAll(String username) throws IOException
      Send a user disconnect notification to all.
      Parameters:
      username - Username of disconnecting principal client.
      Throws:

    • sendMessageToAll

      public void sendMessageToAll(String username, String message) throws IOException
      Send message to all (except principal client).
      Parameters:
      username - Username of sending client.
      message - Message of sending client.
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException might be thrown if socket encounters and IO error.

    • sendServerDialogToAll

      public void sendServerDialogToAll(String message) throws IOException
      Send formatted server dialog to all. Used to let server communicate with clients.
      Parameters:
      message - Server message.
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException might be thrown if socket encounters and IO error.

    • sendServerCommand

      public void sendServerCommand(String command) throws IOException
      Send server command. Used to send work commands to clients such as changing server name.
      Parameters:
      command - Command to send to clients.
      Throws:
      IOException - IOException might be thrown if socket encounters and IO error.
